test_cases.scenario: Scenario 1: fetch cache setting verification - version-checker.ts fetch call has cache: 'no-store'
test_cases.evidence: version-checker.ts line 195 contains cache: 'no-store' in the fetch call to GITHUB_API_URL. Unit test 'should pass cache: no-store to fetch to prevent Next.js Data Cache' in version-checker.test.ts (line 578-601) verifies this. Integration test issue-278-acceptance.test.ts confirms both the setting and Issue #278 comment presence. All 57 version-checker tests passed.

test_cases.scenario: Scenario 2: Desktop Info button shows update indicator when hasUpdate=true
test_cases.evidence: WorktreeDetailRefactored.tsx DesktopHeader component (line 576-582) conditionally renders NotificationDot with data-testid='info-update-indicator' when hasUpdate is true. Unit test in WorktreeDetailRefactored.test.tsx (line 1224-1237) verifies the indicator appears when useUpdateCheck returns hasUpdate: true. Integration acceptance test confirms the pattern.

test_cases.scenario: Scenario 3: Desktop Info button hides indicator when hasUpdate=false
test_cases.evidence: DesktopHeader only renders NotificationDot inside {hasUpdate && ...} conditional. Unit tests at WorktreeDetailRefactored.test.tsx lines 1239-1253 and 1255-1269 verify the indicator is not present when hasUpdate=false or data=null.

test_cases.scenario: Scenario 4: Mobile Info tab shows update indicator when hasUpdate=true
test_cases.evidence: MobileTabBar.tsx (line 175-181) conditionally renders NotificationDot with data-testid='info-update-badge' when tab.id==='info' && hasUpdate. Unit test in MobileTabBar.test.tsx (lines 296-301) verifies the badge appears. Unit test at line 315-323 confirms the badge is inside the info tab button. All 36 MobileTabBar tests passed.

test_cases.scenario: Scenario 5: Mobile Info tab hides indicator when hasUpdate=false
test_cases.evidence: MobileTabBar renders the badge only when hasUpdate is true. Tests at MobileTabBar.test.tsx lines 303-307 (hasUpdate=false) and 309-313 (hasUpdate=undefined) both verify the badge is not present.

test_cases.scenario: Scenario 6: NotificationDot shared component props work correctly
test_cases.evidence: NotificationDot.tsx in src/components/common/ supports data-testid, aria-label, and className props. All 12 dedicated tests in notification-dot.test.tsx pass: rendering, data-testid, aria-label, className merging with base styles (w-2 h-2 rounded-full bg-blue-500), empty/undefined className handling, and SEC-SF-001 security constraint documentation.

Full test suite: 168 test files passed, 3342 tests passed, 7 skipped. ESLint: 0 warnings/errors. TypeScript: 0 errors (npx tsc --noEmit). The 1 'unhandled error' in full suite run is a Vitest worker process crash (not a test failure) - all 168 test files show passed status.
